data.name: 9.1.1 Control of  virtual resources
data.description: A plan for control of creating, changing and collecting virtual resources (virtual machine, virtual storage, virtual software, etc.) should be established

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: FTPS Only Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Web Apps have FTPS only access enabled.
tests.more_info: FTPS-only access for your Azure App Services applications, can guarantee that the encrypted traffic between the web application servers and the FTP clients cannot be decrypted by malicious actors.
tests.recommended_action: Enable FTPS-only access for Azure Web Apps

data.name: 9.1.3 Monitoring of  virtual resources
data.description: Safeguards to secure the integrity of virtual resources and changes to virtual resources (modification, relocation, deletion, copying) should be monitored. In addition, the user should be notified of any damage to virtual resources.

tests.title: SQL Server Firewall Rule Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Firewall Rules create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Virtual Network Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Virtual Networks events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Virtual Networks events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Networks create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Security Configuration Monitoring
tests.description: Ensures that Security Configuration Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for security configurations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Security Configuration Monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor NSG Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit the Network Security Groups that are enabled on the VM for permissive rules.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Network Security Group monitoring is configured from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Scale Sets Health Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that health monitoring is enabled for virtual machine scale sets.
tests.more_info: Scale set health monitoring feature reports on VM health from inside the scale set instance and can be configured to probe on an application endpoint and update the status of the application on that instance. That instance status is checked by Azure to determine whether an instance is eligible for upgrade operations.
tests.recommended_action: Enable health monitoring for virtual machine scale sets.

tests.title: Azure Monitor Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Azure Monitor Logs are enabled for all logging categories and being archived in a Storage Account.
tests.more_info: Azure Monitor Logs is a feature of Azure Monitor that collects and organizes log and performance data from monitored resources and helps in identifying issues in resources performance.
tests.recommended_action: Enabled Azure Monitor Logs for all logging categories and archive in a Storage Account

tests.title: Monitor External Accounts with Write Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that External Accounts with Write Permissions are being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: External Accounts with Write Permissions should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for External Accounts with Write Permissions by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'External accounts with write permissions should be removed from your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor IP Forwarding
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Machine IP Forwarding Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: IP Forwarding feature should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable IP Forwarding Monitoring by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'IP Forwarding on your virtual machine should be disabled' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Next Generation Firewall
tests.description: Ensures that Next Generation Firewall (NGFW) Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will search for deployments where a NGFW is recommended.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Next Generation Firewall Monitoring by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'All network ports should be restricted on network security groups associated to your virtual machine' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Total Number of Subscription Owners
tests.description: Ensures that Total Number of Subscription Owners is being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: Total Number of Subscription Owners should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for Total Number of Subscription Owners by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'A maximum of 3 owners should be designated for your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

data.name: 9.1.5 Public server security
data.description: Physical and technical safeguards for websites where virtual resources are provided and public servers used to distribute virtual software (mobile and desktop apps) should be established.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

data.name: 9.2.1 Control of  malicious codes
data.description: Security technologies for detecting and blocking malicious codes to protect the user's virtual environment ( virtual PC, virtual server, virtual software) from malicious codes, including viruses, worms, and Trojan Horse, should be supported.

tests.title: SQL Server Firewall Rule Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Firewall Rules create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Send Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that send alerts is enabled in advanced data security for SQL servers.
tests.more_info: Enabling send alerts in advanced data security on all SQL servers ensures that monitored data for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats get sent to the email addresses configured in advanced data protections.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that an email address is activated under send alerts in advanced data security for all SQL servers.

tests.title: High Severity Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that high severity alerts are properly configured.
tests.more_info: Enabling high severity alerts ensures that microsoft alerts for potential security issues are sent and allows for quick mitigation of the associated risks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that high severity alerts are configured to be sent.

tests.title: SQL Server Recurring Scans Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Period Recurring Scans feature is enabled for SQL Servers.
tests.more_info: Setting periodic recurring scans schedules periodic (weekly) vulnerability scanning for the SQL server and corresponding Databases. Periodic and regular vulnerability scanning provides risk visibility based on updated known vulnerability signatures and best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that recurring scans feature is set to Enabled.

tests.title: SQL Server Send Scan Reports
tests.description: Ensures that Send Scan Reports is enabled for SQL Servers.
tests.more_info: Vulnerability Assessment (VA) scan reports and alerts will be sent to email ids configured at Send scan reports to. This may help in reducing time required for identifying risks and taking corrective measures.
tests.recommended_action: Configure Send scan reports to with email ids of concerned data owners/stakeholders for a critical SQL servers.

data.name: 10.1.1 Establishment of access control policy
data.description: An access control policy that includes the areas and scope of access control and the rules and methods of access control should be established to ensure control of unauthorized access.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Network Access Default Action
tests.description: Ensures that Storage Account access is restricted to trusted networks
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts should be configured to accept traffic only from trusted networks. By default, all networks are selected but can be changed when creating a new storage account or in the firewall settings.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the firewall of each Storage Account to allow access only from known virtual networks.
tests.remediation_description: Default network action will be set to deny all traffic for affected storage accounts

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Authentication is enabled for App Services, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.
tests.more_info: Enabling authentication will redirect all unauthenticated requests to the login page. It also handles authentication of users with specific providers (Azure Active Directory, Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter).
tests.recommended_action: Enable App Service Authentication for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: The App Service Authentication option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: Trusted MS Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Trusted Microsoft Services Access is enabled on Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Enabling firewall rules on Storage Accounts blocks all access by default. To ensure that Microsoft and Azure services that connect to the Storage Account still retain access, trusted Microsoft services should be allowed to access the storage account.
tests.recommended_action: For each Storage Account, configure an exception for trusted Microsoft services.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Cosmos DB Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts are configured to deny public access.
tests.more_info: Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts should not be accessible from internet and only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Modify firewall and the virtual network configuration for your Cosmos DB accounts to provide access to selected networks.

tests.title: VM Active Directory (AD) Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication is enabled for virtual machines.
tests.more_info: Organizations can now improve the security of virtual machines (VMs) in Azure by integrating with Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication. Enabling Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines (VMs) ensures access to VMs from one central point and simplifies access permission management.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: App Service SCM Site Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app.
tests.more_info: In addition to being able to control access to your app, you can restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app. The SCM site is both the web deploy endpoint and the Kudu console.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the scm site used by your app

tests.title: App Service Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services have access restriction configured to control network access to your app.
tests.more_info: By setting up access restrictions, you can define a priority-ordered allow/deny list that controls network access to your app. The list can include IP addresses or Azure Virtual Network subnets. When there are one or more entries, an implicit deny all exists at the end of the list.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the app services
tests.remediation_description: Access restriction rule will be added to deny access from any source for affected app services

tests.title: FTPS Only Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Web Apps have FTPS only access enabled.
tests.more_info: FTPS-only access for your Azure App Services applications, can guarantee that the encrypted traffic between the web application servers and the FTP clients cannot be decrypted by malicious actors.
tests.recommended_action: Enable FTPS-only access for Azure Web Apps

tests.title: Manage Key Access and Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application has administrator privileges to the Key Vaults.
tests.more_info: A principal such as a user, group or application should have access to execute only specific operations for Azure Key Vault keys, secrets or certificates as a security best practice.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application is using administrator privileges.

tests.title: Key Vault Restrict Default Network Access
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults are configured to deny access to traffic from all networks.
tests.more_info: Access to Azure Key Vaults should be granted to specific Virtual Networks, which allow a secure network boundary for specific applications, or to public IP addresses/IP address ranges, which can enable connections from trusted Internet services and on-premises networks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults can only be accessed by specific Virtual Networks.

data.name: 10.2.2 Control of admin and special permissions
data.description: Accounts and permissions granted for control of cloud systems and material information and other special purposes should be identified and controlled separately.

tests.title: ACR Admin User
tests.description: Ensures that the admin user is not enabled on container registries
tests.more_info: Azure Container Registries have an admin user that is designed for testing. This should be disabled by default to avoid sharing confidential admin credentials.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the admin user is disabled for each container registry.

data.name: 10.2.3 Review of access permissions
data.description: The appropriateness of provisioning, use of permissions (not using permissions for a long time) and changes in permissions (retirement, leave, change of duties, transfer) should be regularly checked to manage access to cloud systems and material information.

tests.title: Manage Key Access and Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application has administrator privileges to the Key Vaults.
tests.more_info: A principal such as a user, group or application should have access to execute only specific operations for Azure Key Vault keys, secrets or certificates as a security best practice.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application is using administrator privileges.

data.name: 10.3.1 User identification
data.description: An identifier should be allocated to each user to distinguish the user from other users in a cloud system, and using any identifier from which the identity of the user can be guessed should be restricted. Where an identifier is shared by more than one user, the reason and appropriateness of such a case should be reviewed and approved by the relevant supervisor.

tests.title: Azure Active Directory Admin Configured
tests.description: Ensures that Active Directory admin is set up on all PostgreSQL servers.
tests.more_info: Using Azure Active Directory authentication allows key rotation and permission management to be managed in one location for all servers. This can be done are configuring an Active Directory administrator.
tests.recommended_action: Set up an Active Directory admin for PostgreSQL database servers.

tests.title: VM Active Directory (AD) Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication is enabled for virtual machines.
tests.more_info: Organizations can now improve the security of virtual machines (VMs) in Azure by integrating with Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication. Enabling Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines (VMs) ensures access to VMs from one central point and simplifies access permission management.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines

data.name: 10.3.2 User authentication
data.description: Access to cloud systems should be controlled through a secure user authentication procedure, including user authentication, maximum login attempts, and warning of unauthorized login attempts.

tests.title: Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Authentication is enabled for App Services, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.
tests.more_info: Enabling authentication will redirect all unauthenticated requests to the login page. It also handles authentication of users with specific providers (Azure Active Directory, Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter).
tests.recommended_action: Enable App Service Authentication for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: The App Service Authentication option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: VM Active Directory (AD) Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication is enabled for virtual machines.
tests.more_info: Organizations can now improve the security of virtual machines (VMs) in Azure by integrating with Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication. Enabling Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines (VMs) ensures access to VMs from one central point and simplifies access permission management.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines

data.name: 10.3.4 User password management
data.description: A procedure for managing user password, including password complexity requirements, initial password change, and password change interval, should be established and implemented considering legal requirements and external threats, and it should be ensured that users are aware that they are responsible for keeping their password safe. In particular, admin passwords should be managed under a separate security plan.

tests.title: Password Requires Lowercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require lowercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Numbers
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require numbers
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require symbol characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Uppercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require uppercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require a minimum length
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including the minimum password length, defaulted to 8 characters.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that password authentication is disabled on Azure virtual machines.
tests.more_info: SSH provides secure sign-ins over unsecured connections. Although SSH provides an encrypted connection, using passwords with SSH connections still leaves the VM vulnerable so it is recommended to connect to VM over SSH instead of password.
tests.recommended_action: Disable password authentication on Azure virtual machine

data.name: 11.1.1 Establishment of network security policy
data.description: A security policy and procedure concerning internal and external networks related to cloud computing services should be established.

tests.title: Log Profile Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that Log Profiles have a long retention policy.
tests.more_info: Log retention policies should be configured with sufficient retention to aid in investigation of prior security incidents and for compliance purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the Activity Log export to Event Hub is configured with a retention policy of at least 365 days.

tests.title: Security Policy Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update Security Policy Rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update Security Policy Rule events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Policy Rule create or update events.

tests.title: Audit Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing retention policy is set to greater than 90 days
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity. Having a long retention policy ensures that all logs are kept for auditing and legal purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the storage account retention policy for each SQL server is set to greater than 90 days.

tests.title: Policy Assignment Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update and delete Policy Assignment events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Policy Assignment events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Policy Assignment create or update and delete events.

data.name: 11.1.2 Monitoring and control of network
data.description: Networks should be monitored and controlled to prevent service downtime and leakage of material information due to DDoS and unauthorized access, etc.

tests.title: SQL Server Firewall Rule Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Firewall Rules create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Virtual Network Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Virtual Networks events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Virtual Networks events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Networks create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Security Configuration Monitoring
tests.description: Ensures that Security Configuration Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for security configurations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Security Configuration Monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: Security Policy Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update Security Policy Rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update Security Policy Rule events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Policy Rule create or update events.

tests.title: Monitor System Updates
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor System Updates is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit virtual machines for pending OS or system updates.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure System Update monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Admin Security Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that security alerts are configured to be sent to admins
tests.more_info: Enabling security alerts to be sent to admins ensures that detected vulnerabilities and security issues are sent to the subscription admins for quick remediation.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that security alerts are configured to be sent to subscription owners.

tests.title: Monitor NSG Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit the Network Security Groups that are enabled on the VM for permissive rules.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Network Security Group monitoring is configured from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Send Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that send alerts is enabled in advanced data security for SQL servers.
tests.more_info: Enabling send alerts in advanced data security on all SQL servers ensures that monitored data for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats get sent to the email addresses configured in advanced data protections.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that an email address is activated under send alerts in advanced data security for all SQL servers.

tests.title: Policy Assignment Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update and delete Policy Assignment events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Policy Assignment events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Policy Assignment create or update and delete events.

tests.title: High Severity Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that high severity alerts are properly configured.
tests.more_info: Enabling high severity alerts ensures that microsoft alerts for potential security issues are sent and allows for quick mitigation of the associated risks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that high severity alerts are configured to be sent.

tests.title: Scale Sets Health Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that health monitoring is enabled for virtual machine scale sets.
tests.more_info: Scale set health monitoring feature reports on VM health from inside the scale set instance and can be configured to probe on an application endpoint and update the status of the application on that instance. That instance status is checked by Azure to determine whether an instance is eligible for upgrade operations.
tests.recommended_action: Enable health monitoring for virtual machine scale sets.
