tests.title: Azure Monitor Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Azure Monitor Logs are enabled for all logging categories and being archived in a Storage Account.
tests.more_info: Azure Monitor Logs is a feature of Azure Monitor that collects and organizes log and performance data from monitored resources and helps in identifying issues in resources performance.
tests.recommended_action: Enabled Azure Monitor Logs for all logging categories and archive in a Storage Account

tests.title: Monitor External Accounts with Write Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that External Accounts with Write Permissions are being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: External Accounts with Write Permissions should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for External Accounts with Write Permissions by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'External accounts with write permissions should be removed from your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor IP Forwarding
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Machine IP Forwarding Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: IP Forwarding feature should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable IP Forwarding Monitoring by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'IP Forwarding on your virtual machine should be disabled' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Next Generation Firewall
tests.description: Ensures that Next Generation Firewall (NGFW) Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will search for deployments where a NGFW is recommended.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Next Generation Firewall Monitoring by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'All network ports should be restricted on network security groups associated to your virtual machine' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor Total Number of Subscription Owners
tests.description: Ensures that Total Number of Subscription Owners is being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: Total Number of Subscription Owners should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for Total Number of Subscription Owners by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'A maximum of 3 owners should be designated for your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: SQL Server Database Rename Alert Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the rename SQL Server Database events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for rename SQL Server Database events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Database rename events.

tests.title: Virtual Machine Power Off Alert Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the power off Virtual Machine events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for power off Virtual Machine events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Machine power off events.

tests.title: Virtual Machine Deallocate Alert Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Activity Log alerts for the deallocate Virtual Machine events are enabled.
tests.more_info: Monitoring for deallocate Virtual Machine events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Machine deallocate events.

data.name: 11.1.3 Operation of  network information  security system
data.description: Information security systems (firewall, IPS, IDS, VPN, etc.) should be operated to protect internal and external networks related to cloud computing services.

tests.title: Advanced Threat Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Threat Protection feature is enabled for Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts.
tests.more_info: Advanced Threat Protection for Azure Cosmos DB provides an additional layer of security intelligence that detects unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit Azure Cosmos DB accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts to enable advanced threat protection feature.

tests.title: Monitor Next Generation Firewall
tests.description: Ensures that Next Generation Firewall (NGFW) Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will search for deployments where a NGFW is recommended.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Next Generation Firewall Monitoring by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'All network ports should be restricted on network security groups associated to your virtual machine' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: SQL Server Advanced Threat Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Threat Protection is enabled on SQL Servers.
tests.more_info: Azure Defender for SQL is a unified package for advanced SQL security capabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that ThreatDetectionState is set to Enabled

data.name: 11.1.4 Network encryption
data.description: Encrypted communication channels should be used for any section through which material information moves in a cloud system.

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Data Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Data Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM Data Disks (non-boot volume) ensures that its entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM Data Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: TDE Protector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQL Server TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
tests.more_info: Enabling BYOK in the TDE protector allows for greater control and transparency, as well as increasing security by having full control of the encryption keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that a BYOK key is set for the Transparent Data Encryption of each SQL Server.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: TLS Version Check
tests.description: Ensures that all web apps are using the latest version of TLS
tests.more_info: App Services currently allows web apps to use TLS versions 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2. It is highly recommended to use the latest TLS 1.2 version for web app TLS connections.
tests.recommended_action: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Web Apps

tests.title: Enforce MySQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connection is enforced on MySQL servers
tests.more_info: MySQL servers should be set to use SSL for data transmission to ensure all data is encrypted in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security of each Azure Database for MySQL is configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected MySQL servers

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

tests.title: SQL Server Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions.
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to Microsoft Azure SQL server. This setting applies to all databases associated with the server.
tests.recommended_action: Modify SQL server firewall and virtual network settings to set desired minimum TLS version.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected SQL server

tests.title: Disk Volumes BYOK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure virtual machine disks have BYOK (Customer-Managed Key) encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: Encrypting virtual machine disk volumes helps protect and safeguard your data to meet organizational security and compliance commitments.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that virtual machine disks are created using BYOK encryption

tests.title: Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version.
tests.more_info: TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 are known to be susceptible to attacks, and to have other Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) weaknesses.So there's an industry- wide push toward the exclusive use of Transport Layer Security(TLS) version 1.2 or later.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Azure cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: Storage Accounts Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure Storage Accounts are using the latest TLS version 1.2 to enforce stricter security measure.
tests.more_info: Azure Storage accounts permit clients to send and receive data with the oldest version of TLS, TLS 1.0, and above. To enforce stricter security measures, you can configure your storage account to require that clients send and receive data with a newer version of TLS.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Storage Account configuration and set desired minimum TLS version
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Storage Accounts

tests.title: SSL Certificate Auto Renewal
tests.description: Ensures that Microsoft Azure Key Vault SSL certificates have auto renewal enabled.
tests.more_info: Configure auto renewal for SSL certificates in order to prevent any application or service outage, credential leak, or process violation that can disrupt your business.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Key Vault SSL certificates are configured to have auto renewal enabled.

data.name: 11.1.5 Network segmentation
data.description: Network access should be physically or logically segregated among the admin area of the cloud computing service provider, user service area, and inter-user service area.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

data.name: 12.1.2 Data ownership
data.description: Data ownership should be clearly established at the stage of establishing a service level agreement with the user.

tests.title: No Custom Owner Roles
tests.description: Ensures that no custom owner roles exist.
tests.more_info: Subscription owners should not include permissions to create custom owner roles. This follows the principle of least privilege.
tests.recommended_action: Remove roles that allow permissions to create custom owner roles.

tests.title: Monitor Total Number of Subscription Owners
tests.description: Ensures that Total Number of Subscription Owners is being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: Total Number of Subscription Owners should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for Total Number of Subscription Owners by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'A maximum of 3 owners should be designated for your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

data.name: 12.1.3 Data integrity
data.description: Data input/output, data transmission or exchange and data at rest should always be checked for its data integrity.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: TLS Version Check
tests.description: Ensures that all web apps are using the latest version of TLS
tests.more_info: App Services currently allows web apps to use TLS versions 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2. It is highly recommended to use the latest TLS 1.2 version for web app TLS connections.
tests.recommended_action: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Web Apps

tests.title: Database Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database Auditing is enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Database Auditing ensures that all database activities are being logged properly, including potential malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.

tests.title: Audit Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing retention policy is set to greater than 90 days
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity. Having a long retention policy ensures that all logs are kept for auditing and legal purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the storage account retention policy for each SQL server is set to greater than 90 days.

tests.title: Audit Action Groups Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is configured properly
tests.more_info: SQL Server Audit Action and Groups should be configured to at least include SUCCESSFUL_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP, FAILED_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP and BATCH_COMPLETED_GROUP.
tests.recommended_action: If SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is not configured properly when enabling Auditing, these settings must be configured in Powershell.

tests.title: Server Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing is enabled for SQL servers
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL server.

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

tests.title: SQL Server Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions.
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to Microsoft Azure SQL server. This setting applies to all databases associated with the server.
tests.recommended_action: Modify SQL server firewall and virtual network settings to set desired minimum TLS version.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected SQL server

tests.title: VM Backups Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure virtual machine backups are enabled.
tests.more_info: Azure Backup provides independent and isolated backups to guard against unintended destruction of the data on your VMs.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Azure virtual machine backups

tests.title: Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version.
tests.more_info: TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 are known to be susceptible to attacks, and to have other Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) weaknesses.So there's an industry- wide push toward the exclusive use of Transport Layer Security(TLS) version 1.2 or later.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Azure cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: Storage Accounts Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure Storage Accounts are using the latest TLS version 1.2 to enforce stricter security measure.
tests.more_info: Azure Storage accounts permit clients to send and receive data with the oldest version of TLS, TLS 1.0, and above. To enforce stricter security measures, you can configure your storage account to require that clients send and receive data with a newer version of TLS.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Storage Account configuration and set desired minimum TLS version
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Storage Accounts

tests.title: Web Apps Backup Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Web Apps have automated backups enabled.
tests.more_info: Protect your Azure App Services web applications against accidental deletion and/or corruption, you can configure application backups to create restorable copies of your app content.
tests.recommended_action: Configure backup for Azure Web Apps

tests.title: SSL Certificate Auto Renewal
tests.description: Ensures that Microsoft Azure Key Vault SSL certificates have auto renewal enabled.
tests.more_info: Configure auto renewal for SSL certificates in order to prevent any application or service outage, credential leak, or process violation that can disrupt your business.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Key Vault SSL certificates are configured to have auto renewal enabled.

data.name: 12.1.4 Data protection
data.description: Data protection functions, such as data access control and forgery prevention, should be provided to users.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures that VM Endpoint Protection is enabled for all virtual machines
tests.more_info: Installing endpoint protection systems provides for real-time protection capabilities that help identify and remove viruses, spyware, and other malicious software, with configurable alerts for malicious or unwanted software.
tests.recommended_action: Install endpoint protection on all virtual machines.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Network Access Default Action
tests.description: Ensures that Storage Account access is restricted to trusted networks
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts should be configured to accept traffic only from trusted networks. By default, all networks are selected but can be changed when creating a new storage account or in the firewall settings.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the firewall of each Storage Account to allow access only from known virtual networks.
tests.remediation_description: Default network action will be set to deny all traffic for affected storage accounts

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: Trusted MS Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Trusted Microsoft Services Access is enabled on Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Enabling firewall rules on Storage Accounts blocks all access by default. To ensure that Microsoft and Azure services that connect to the Storage Account still retain access, trusted Microsoft services should be allowed to access the storage account.
tests.recommended_action: For each Storage Account, configure an exception for trusted Microsoft services.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: DDoS Standard Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that DDoS Standard Protection is enabled for Microsoft Azure Virtual Networks
tests.more_info: DDoS Protection Standard offers enhanced Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) mitigation capabilities via adaptive tuning, attack alert notifications, and telemetry to protect against the impacts of large DDoS attacks for all the protected resources available within your Azure Virtual Networks.
tests.recommended_action: Enable DDoS protection for virtual networks

tests.title: Cosmos DB Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts are configured to deny public access.
tests.more_info: Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts should not be accessible from internet and only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Modify firewall and the virtual network configuration for your Cosmos DB accounts to provide access to selected networks.

tests.title: Advanced Threat Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Threat Protection feature is enabled for Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts.
tests.more_info: Advanced Threat Protection for Azure Cosmos DB provides an additional layer of security intelligence that detects unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit Azure Cosmos DB accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts to enable advanced threat protection feature.

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: App Service SCM Site Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app.
tests.more_info: In addition to being able to control access to your app, you can restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app. The SCM site is both the web deploy endpoint and the Kudu console.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the scm site used by your app

tests.title: App Service Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services have access restriction configured to control network access to your app.
tests.more_info: By setting up access restrictions, you can define a priority-ordered allow/deny list that controls network access to your app. The list can include IP addresses or Azure Virtual Network subnets. When there are one or more entries, an implicit deny all exists at the end of the list.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the app services
tests.remediation_description: Access restriction rule will be added to deny access from any source for affected app services

tests.title: SQL Server Advanced Threat Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Threat Protection is enabled on SQL Servers.
tests.more_info: Azure Defender for SQL is a unified package for advanced SQL security capabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that ThreatDetectionState is set to Enabled

tests.title: FTPS Only Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Web Apps have FTPS only access enabled.
tests.more_info: FTPS-only access for your Azure App Services applications, can guarantee that the encrypted traffic between the web application servers and the FTP clients cannot be decrypted by malicious actors.
tests.recommended_action: Enable FTPS-only access for Azure Web Apps

tests.title: Manage Key Access and Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application has administrator privileges to the Key Vaults.
tests.more_info: A principal such as a user, group or application should have access to execute only specific operations for Azure Key Vault keys, secrets or certificates as a security best practice.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application is using administrator privileges.

tests.title: Key Vault Restrict Default Network Access
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults are configured to deny access to traffic from all networks.
tests.more_info: Access to Azure Key Vaults should be granted to specific Virtual Networks, which allow a secure network boundary for specific applications, or to public IP addresses/IP address ranges, which can enable connections from trusted Internet services and on-premises networks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults can only be accessed by specific Virtual Networks.

data.name: 12.3.1 Establishment of encryption policy
data.description: To protect data at rest or in transit in a cloud computing service, a policy concerning encryption targets, encryption strength (complexity), key management, and password use, should be established. It should be ensured that the policy reflects legal requirements relating to encryption, such as encrypting personal data when it is stored or transmitted.

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Data Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Data Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM Data Disks (non-boot volume) ensures that its entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM Data Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: TDE Protector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQL Server TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
tests.more_info: Enabling BYOK in the TDE protector allows for greater control and transparency, as well as increasing security by having full control of the encryption keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that a BYOK key is set for the Transparent Data Encryption of each SQL Server.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: Disk Volumes BYOK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure virtual machine disks have BYOK (Customer-Managed Key) encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: Encrypting virtual machine disk volumes helps protect and safeguard your data to meet organizational security and compliance commitments.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that virtual machine disks are created using BYOK encryption

data.name: 12.3.2 Encryption key management
data.description: A secure procedure concerning the creation, use, storage, distribution and destruction of encryption keys should be established, and encryption keys should be stored in a separate secure location.

tests.title: Allowed Certificates Key Types
tests.description: Ensures that Microsoft Azure Key Vault SSL certificates are using the allowed key types.
tests.more_info: Having the right key type set for your Azure Key Vault SSL certificates will enforce the best practices as specified in the security and compliance regulations implemented within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Key Vault SSL certificates are using the allowed key types.

data.name: 13.1.2 Authentication and  encryption functions
data.description: When a cloud system is designed, security requirements concerning user authentication must be taken into account, and legal requirements should also be considered where integrity and confidentiality are required in the process of inputting/outputting and transmitting/receiving material data.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Authentication is enabled for App Services, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.
tests.more_info: Enabling authentication will redirect all unauthenticated requests to the login page. It also handles authentication of users with specific providers (Azure Active Directory, Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter).
tests.recommended_action: Enable App Service Authentication for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: The App Service Authentication option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: TLS Version Check
tests.description: Ensures that all web apps are using the latest version of TLS
tests.more_info: App Services currently allows web apps to use TLS versions 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2. It is highly recommended to use the latest TLS 1.2 version for web app TLS connections.
tests.recommended_action: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Web Apps

tests.title: Enforce MySQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connection is enforced on MySQL servers
tests.more_info: MySQL servers should be set to use SSL for data transmission to ensure all data is encrypted in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security of each Azure Database for MySQL is configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected MySQL servers

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

tests.title: SQL Server Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions.
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to Microsoft Azure SQL server. This setting applies to all databases associated with the server.
tests.recommended_action: Modify SQL server firewall and virtual network settings to set desired minimum TLS version.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected SQL server

tests.title: Password Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that password authentication is disabled on Azure virtual machines.
tests.more_info: SSH provides secure sign-ins over unsecured connections. Although SSH provides an encrypted connection, using passwords with SSH connections still leaves the VM vulnerable so it is recommended to connect to VM over SSH instead of password.
tests.recommended_action: Disable password authentication on Azure virtual machine

tests.title: VM Active Directory (AD) Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication is enabled for virtual machines.
tests.more_info: Organizations can now improve the security of virtual machines (VMs) in Azure by integrating with Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication. Enabling Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines (VMs) ensures access to VMs from one central point and simplifies access permission management.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Azure Active Directory (AD) authentication for Azure virtual machines

tests.title: Disk Volumes BYOK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure virtual machine disks have BYOK (Customer-Managed Key) encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: Encrypting virtual machine disk volumes helps protect and safeguard your data to meet organizational security and compliance commitments.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that virtual machine disks are created using BYOK encryption

tests.title: Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version.
tests.more_info: TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 are known to be susceptible to attacks, and to have other Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) weaknesses.So there's an industry- wide push toward the exclusive use of Transport Layer Security(TLS) version 1.2 or later.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Azure cache for Redis is using the latest TLS version

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: Storage Accounts Minimum TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures Microsoft Azure Storage Accounts are using the latest TLS version 1.2 to enforce stricter security measure.
tests.more_info: Azure Storage accounts permit clients to send and receive data with the oldest version of TLS, TLS 1.0, and above. To enforce stricter security measures, you can configure your storage account to require that clients send and receive data with a newer version of TLS.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Storage Account configuration and set desired minimum TLS version
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Storage Accounts

tests.title: SSL Certificate Auto Renewal
tests.description: Ensures that Microsoft Azure Key Vault SSL certificates have auto renewal enabled.
tests.more_info: Configure auto renewal for SSL certificates in order to prevent any application or service outage, credential leak, or process violation that can disrupt your business.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Key Vault SSL certificates are configured to have auto renewal enabled.

data.name: 13.1.3 Security log functions
data.description: A cloud system should be designed to collect audit trails concerning user authentication, change to permissions, use and leakage of material information, etc

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: Endpoint Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that endpoint requests are being logged for CDN endpoints
tests.more_info: Endpoint Logging ensures that all requests to a CDN endpoint are logged.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that diagnostic logging is enabled for each CDN endpoint for each CDN profile

tests.title: Log Profile Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that Log Profiles have a long retention policy.
tests.more_info: Log retention policies should be configured with sufficient retention to aid in investigation of prior security incidents and for compliance purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the Activity Log export to Event Hub is configured with a retention policy of at least 365 days.

tests.title: Security Solution Logging
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Security Solution events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Security Solution events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Solution create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Database Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database Auditing is enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Database Auditing ensures that all database activities are being logged properly, including potential malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.

tests.title: Log Retention Period
tests.description: Ensures logs are configured to be retained for 4 or more days for PostgreSQL servers
tests.more_info: Having a long log retention policy ensures that all critical logs are stored for long enough to access and view in case of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the server parameters for each PostgreSQL server have the log_retention_days setting set to 4 or more days.

tests.title: Log Connections Enabled
tests.description: Ensures connection logs are enabled for PostgreSQL servers
tests.more_info: Connection logs ensure all attempted and successful connections to the server are logged.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the server parameters for each PostgreSQL server have the log_connections setting enabled.

tests.title: Log Checkpoints Enabled
tests.description: Ensures log checkpoints are enabled for PostgreSQL servers
tests.more_info: Log checkpoints logs queries and errors that arise in the server, enabling faster detection of incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the server parameters for each PostgreSQL server have the log_checkpoints setting enabled.

tests.title: Audit Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing retention policy is set to greater than 90 days
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity. Having a long retention policy ensures that all logs are kept for auditing and legal purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the storage account retention policy for each SQL server is set to greater than 90 days.

tests.title: Audit Action Groups Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is configured properly
tests.more_info: SQL Server Audit Action and Groups should be configured to at least include SUCCESSFUL_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP, FAILED_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP and BATCH_COMPLETED_GROUP.
tests.recommended_action: If SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is not configured properly when enabling Auditing, these settings must be configured in Powershell.

tests.title: Server Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing is enabled for SQL servers
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL server.

tests.title: Key Vault Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create/update and delete Key Vault events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create/update and delete Key Vault events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Key Vault create/update and delete events.

tests.title: Storage Account Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create/update and delete Storage Account events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create/update and delete Storage Account events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Storage Account create/update and delete events.

tests.title: SQL Server Database Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete SQL Server Database events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete SQL Server Database events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Database create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Load Balancers Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete Load Balancers events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Load Balancers events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Load Balancers create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Virtual Machine Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create/update and delete Virtual Machine events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create/update and delete Virtual Machine events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Machine create/update and delete events.

data.name: 13.1.4 Provisioning functions
data.description: A cloud system should be designed to grant access permissions on the basis of the purpose and materiality of business.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Network Access Default Action
tests.description: Ensures that Storage Account access is restricted to trusted networks
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts should be configured to accept traffic only from trusted networks. By default, all networks are selected but can be changed when creating a new storage account or in the firewall settings.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the firewall of each Storage Account to allow access only from known virtual networks.
tests.remediation_description: Default network action will be set to deny all traffic for affected storage accounts

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: Trusted MS Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Trusted Microsoft Services Access is enabled on Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Enabling firewall rules on Storage Accounts blocks all access by default. To ensure that Microsoft and Azure services that connect to the Storage Account still retain access, trusted Microsoft services should be allowed to access the storage account.
tests.recommended_action: For each Storage Account, configure an exception for trusted Microsoft services.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Cosmos DB Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts are configured to deny public access.
tests.more_info: Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB accounts should not be accessible from internet and only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Modify firewall and the virtual network configuration for your Cosmos DB accounts to provide access to selected networks.

tests.title: SSL Access Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SSL Access Only feature is enabled for Azure Redis Caches.
tests.more_info: SSL Access only should be enabled for Azure Cache for Redis to meet the organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable SSL Access Only for Azure cache for Redis

tests.title: Monitor External Accounts with Write Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that External Accounts with Write Permissions are being Monitored in Security Center
tests.more_info: External Accounts with Write Permissions should be monitored to meet you organization's security compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Monitor for External Accounts with Write Permissions by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for 'External accounts with write permissions should be removed from your subscription' from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: App Service SCM Site Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app.
tests.more_info: In addition to being able to control access to your app, you can restrict access to the SCM site that's used by your app. The SCM site is both the web deploy endpoint and the Kudu console.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the scm site used by your app

tests.title: App Service Access Restriction
tests.description: Ensure that Azure App Services have access restriction configured to control network access to your app.
tests.more_info: By setting up access restrictions, you can define a priority-ordered allow/deny list that controls network access to your app. The list can include IP addresses or Azure Virtual Network subnets. When there are one or more entries, an implicit deny all exists at the end of the list.
tests.recommended_action: Add access restriction rules under network settings for the app services
tests.remediation_description: Access restriction rule will be added to deny access from any source for affected app services

tests.title: FTPS Only Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Azure Web Apps have FTPS only access enabled.
tests.more_info: FTPS-only access for your Azure App Services applications, can guarantee that the encrypted traffic between the web application servers and the FTP clients cannot be decrypted by malicious actors.
tests.recommended_action: Enable FTPS-only access for Azure Web Apps

tests.title: Manage Key Access and Permissions
tests.description: Ensures that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application has administrator privileges to the Key Vaults.
tests.more_info: A principal such as a user, group or application should have access to execute only specific operations for Azure Key Vault keys, secrets or certificates as a security best practice.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Microsoft Azure user, group or application is using administrator privileges.

tests.title: Key Vault Restrict Default Network Access
tests.description: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults are configured to deny access to traffic from all networks.
tests.more_info: Access to Azure Key Vaults should be granted to specific Virtual Networks, which allow a secure network boundary for specific applications, or to public IP addresses/IP address ranges, which can enable connections from trusted Internet services and on-premises networks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Microsoft Azure Key Vaults can only be accessed by specific Virtual Networks.
